title: Great Calcutta Killings
summary: Communal violence erupts in Calcutta on Direct Action Day, killing thousands.
description: The Muslim League called for a "Direct Action Day" on August 16, 1946, demanding the creation of Pakistan. The ensuing violence in Calcutta left an estimated 4,000–10,000 people dead.

title: Noakhali Riots
summary: Communal riots break out in the Noakhali district of Bengal.

title: Asian Relations Conference
summary: First major inter-Asian conference held in New Delhi, chaired by Nehru.

title: Partition of Bengal
summary: Bengal is divided between India (West Bengal) and Pakistan (East Bengal).
description: The partition displaced millions of people and triggered one of the largest mass migrations in human history, accompanied by widespread communal violence.

title: Telangana Rebellion
summary: Armed peasant revolt in the Telangana region against the Nizam of Hyderabad.

title: Operation Polo — Hyderabad
summary: Indian military operation annexes the princely state of Hyderabad.
